feature_bullets: 1.【Motor Controller】Power controller Dedicated iron,soldering iron Temperature control,tip Power controller ,0 ~ 200W.

2.【Widely Used】Rated power: 120V AC 50/60Hz, dimmable LED 50W, dimmable energy saving bulb 100W, incandescent bulb 200W;For desk lamps, ceiling fans, electric soldering irons, exhaust fans, industrial fans, below 200W.
3.【Easy to Install】No wiring required,No need to install and in-wall dimming device,Just plug in and use directly.
4.【Tips】The minimum load of this dimmer switch must be more than 5W,too small load will cause abnormality.
5.【Buy with Confidence】UL listed,1 Year warranty under normal use.Any questions,please contact us without hesitate.

customers_say: Customers find the dimmer switch works well, with one mentioning it's perfect for indoor LED string lights, and they appreciate its ability to adjust to pleasing brightness levels. The device is straightforward to install, with one customer noting there's no complicated wiring required, and they like its neat design, with one describing it as a small good-looking housing. Customers find it reasonably priced and of good quality, though one customer reports issues with reversed polarity.AI Generated from the text of customer reviews

customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: Works great! as expected... I use it for a large fan for finer speed control...

customer_reviews.rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars5.0 out of 5 stars
customer_reviews.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 starsNice dimmer. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: Just as described and works great dimming the light in my curio.No more having to open the door of the cabinet, rattling my precious contents, to find and turn the light on.

customer_reviews.rating: 4.0 out of 5 stars4.0 out of 5 stars
customer_reviews.review_title: 4.0 out of 5 starsNice dimmer switch. Mfr has reversed plug orientation.
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: Update:  I use this with a strip of low voltage, dimmer-compatible, under-cabinet LED lights. The lights will occasionally, not frequently, blink (off-on) when controlled by this switch. This isn’t related to any other load kicking in or anything like that. I’ve only used this switch in the lower half of its range so don’t know if the problem would occur throughout the dimmer range. I missed the return/exchange cutoff date, so I am living with it, which isn’t hard as it doesn’t hamper the work that’s being illuminated. Could be a flaw in just this particular unit, and I still like the switch.Originally:  This is a nice, smoothly operating dimmer switch. I like the large rotary knob. I am using it with under cabinet LED light bars, and the switch seems to vary the light intensity over the entire range, 10-100% according to the light's manual, in a linear fashion. Funny thing, though—when I chose this unit I was happy to see from product photos that the neutral (wide) blade of the switch was on the right. This mean that for most electrical outlets, at least in the U.S., the switch would have to be plugged in upside down, with the receptacle for the device the switch was controlling pointing up. Some reviewers remarked that this was unfortunate, but for my application it was perfect. Now that I have the switch, I see that the manufacturer has reversed the plug orientation, probably in response to criticism, which probably will make 90 percent of customers happy. I opened the unit to see if the plug orientation could be easily reversed, but that does not seem to be the case. (I think that would be a cool feature to have. I now see that a diagram and a customer photo on the product page does show this wide-blade-on-the-left orientation, but as of this date the seller's product photos and videos still show the opposite.) So, I will be turning the receptacle in my outlet box over (for those who don't know, the electrical code does not specify that for households the orientation of receptacles has to be any specific way) so I can use this nice dimmer switch upside down, the way that will work better for me.

customer_reviews.review_title: 1.0 out of 5 starsDid not work on my stove fan
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2024
customer_reviews.review_snippet: Small "squirrel cage" fan - draws 75W/130VAR on low - and would not run at any setting on the knob.  It was possible at the highest setting - if you were very careful - to get it to run - like a sweet spot on the dial.  But that was intermittent and any other position would not work.  It did power up a small table fan and worked fine for that.  My other comment - has no ground - only 2 prong - so if you have a 3 prong plug you will have to get a "cheater" plug.  My stove fan had 3 prongs - and even if it had worked I would have had some concerned about it.

customer_reviews.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWorked perfect! Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
customer_reviews.review_snippet: I'm seriously impressed with these dimmers! I recently took on a project where I built a false stud wall with sconces for a video studio. The goal was to create some stylish back lighting without the hassle of wiring in traditional dimmer switches. That's where these dimmers came into play, and let me tell you, they were a game changer.I simply wired the lights behind the wall to a plug and connected them to this switch. The setup was a breeze – no complicated wiring, no permanent alterations, just straightforward, effective lighting control. It's the perfect blend of simplicity and functionality. For anyone looking to add a touch of adjustable lighting without the usual fuss, these dimmers are the way to go!

customer_reviews.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThis dimmer is a life saver
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2024
customer_reviews.review_snippet: For my Birthday I purchased a fancy accent lamp. Don't know how to open to change bulb. Very pricy. However that bulb inside was blindingly bright. And I needed a dimmer to level down the high beams. Best purchase ever.

customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2024
customer_reviews.review_snippet: Works perfectly. I am using it to dim a portrait light.

customer_reviews.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 starsGreatest thing since sliced bread?
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2024
customer_reviews.review_snippet: I own some fans that, even on their lowest setting, can be too strong at times.  This controller - a rheostat - enables me to set my fans to a gentle breeze, which is sometimes all you need.  To me, it's invaluable.
